intro.description:
This cheat sheet shows you how to create a view that joins data from 2 sources.
Note: These steps are sequential and require you to complete or skip each step before being allowed to Perform, Complete or Skip the next step.
To learn more about using cheat sheets click the help icon above.
Press "Click to Begin" button below to start.

description.b: Follow the steps below to create a new Relational View Model.

subitem.description:
1) Specify a unique model name.
2) Click Finish

description.b: Follow the steps below to create a new View Table in the Relational View Model.

subitem.description:
1) Specify a unique table Name
2) Click OK

item.title: Add Source Tables to View Transformation

description.b: Follow the steps below to define the View Transformation.

subitem.description:
1) Double-click the View Table in the ModelExplorer View to open Transformation Diagram.
2) Double-click the "T" Transformation Icon on the Diagram to open Transformation Editor.
3) Utilize the Transformation Diagram Toolbar Icons and Transformation Editor to define the desired transformation, including the desired tables from the previously-defined sources.
4) Click Save/Validate on the Transformation Editor to validate the transformation.
